sources.description: The East Side Kids discover that one of their own, Danny, is torn between staying and school and becoming a boxer, and is getting mixed up with gangsters.

sources.title: Bowery Blitzkrieg (1941) THE EAST SIDE KIDS
sources.description:
Stars: Leo Gorcey, Bobby Jordan, Huntz Hall
Director: Wallace Fox

While a cop steers a kid street-fighter away from being a public nuisance, a petty hoodlum leads a studious kid into a life of crime.

sources.title: Bowery Blitzkrieg (1941) East Side Kids | Comedy, Crime, Drama
sources.description:
While a cop steers a kid street-fighter away from being a public nuisance, a petty hoodlum leads a studious kid into a life of crime.
 
Director: Wallace Fox
Writers: Brendan Wood, Donn Mullahy
Stars: Bobby Jordan & The East Side Kids; Leo Gorcey (as Muggs McGinnis) Bobby Jordan (as Danny), Huntz Hall (as Limpy), Donald Haines (as Skinny), Sunshine Sammy Morrison (as Scruno), David Gorcey (as Peewee)
Genres: Comedy,Crime,Drama,Romance,Sport

metadata.Plot: East Side Kids: Fighters Danny Breslin and Muggs McGinnis, once boyhood chums, have drifted apart. Policeman Tom Brady - because his own former friend fell into a life of crime and got the electric chair - takes rough and tumble Muggs under his wing to turn the lad's life around, but Danny, brother of Mary Breslin (whom Tom plans to marry), is also at risk. Everyone believes studious Danny is on his way to being president someday, but while Tom's focus goes toward putting Muggs on the straight and narrow, ambitious petty criminal Monk Martin's been working slyly on steering Danny into a life of crime. Adding a little complication, racketeers get involved, trying to set up a fixed fight with Muggs.
metadata.Writer: Brendan Wood, Donn Mullahy, Sam Robins
metadata.Actors: Leo Gorcey, Bobby Jordan, Huntz Hall
